info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning
info.description:
At 02:52 pm, MetService weather radar detected severe thunderstorms near MIDDLEMARCH and ROCK AND PILLAR.
These severe thunderstorms are moving towards the southeast, and are expected to lie near MIDDLEMARCH, ROCK AND PILLAR and SUTTON at 03:22 pm and near MIDDLEMARCH, ROCK AND PILLAR, SUTTON and HUMMOCK (BETWEEN MIDDLEMARCH AND WAIKOUAITI) at 03:52 pm.
These thunderstorms are expected to be accompanied by very heavy rain, large hail and frequent lightning.
Impact:
Very heavy rain can cause surface and/or flash flooding about streams, gullies and urban areas, and make driving conditions extremely hazardous.
Large hail can cause significant damage to crops, orchards, vines, glasshouses and vehicles, and make driving conditions hazardous.
Frequent lightning is dangerous to people and livestock, especially those exposed outdoors or on the water, and can cause power surges and damage to electrical equipment.
